comment: "I've been working for PW as a reviewer for about six years. I've recently (in the last few months) gotten a pay bump to $30 from their typical flat rate of $25. The money is not great, but establishing an ongoing relationship with them has helped establish my credentials in the industry. Keeping which books I review a secret can be extremely frustrating, though."
relationship: Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication

"I've worked for Publisher's Weekly for a little over a year. They pay a flat $25 per review. The review is strictly 220-250 words. They make some exceptions for larger works. I was paid $75 for [article name redacted].

There are also opportunities to interview authors. That pays $50. The interview is usually 500 words. 5 questions."
